title: Batch conversion to TTF | Mac FontLab 4.6
content: What's making me the craziest is the fact that I did this on about a dozen fonts last month, and I can't for the life of me recall how to do it again. I need to convert a series of Type 1 fonts to TTF format for use on a companion PC using FontLab 4.6. I thought there was something in the Tools bar, but can't seem to find the right one. I don't own or have a reason to buy TransType, so anyone with some help would be much appreciated. Thank you!
author: spylab

comments.content: You can use the 'Action Set' tools to do this (shift+ctrl+T on Windows), or a Python script.

Tools / Transform Range, Transformation Range: Fonts in the Fonts List, ..., +, add the fonts you want to convert, Destination format: choose the destination format, Destination folder: choose the destination folder, OK, Run.
